title: Euro zone inflation rises to 2.6% in July, above expectations
content: Headline inflation in the euro zone unexpectedly rose to 2.6% in June, the European Union's statistics agency said Wednesday.
summary: Headline inflation in the euro zone unexpectedly rose to 2.6% in June, the European Union's statistics agency said Wednesday.

title: ASML shares pop 7% after report that U.S. will exempt allies from new China chip restrictions
content: Reuters reported that the U.S. is considering expanding chip export restrictions to China, but countries including the Netherlands and Japan would be excluded.
summary: Reuters reported that the U.S. is considering expanding chip export restrictions to China, but countries including the Netherlands and Japan would be excluded.

title: Bank of England's rate cut is on a knife-edge even with inflation on target
content: Members of the central bank's voting Monetary Policy Committee are divided.
summary: Members of the central bank's voting Monetary Policy Committee are divided.

title: Brent tops $80 per barrel as oil analyst flags ‘phase of deterioration’ in the Middle East
content: Iran's claim that Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh was assassinated have rekindled tensions in the Middle East, shoring up oil prices.
summary: Iran's claim that Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh was assassinated have rekindled tensions in the Middle East, shoring up oil prices.

title: HSBC shares rise 3% after profit beat, $3 billion buyback announcement
content: HSBC posted a narrow decline in pretax profit in the first half of the year, but beat expectations on the back of a high-interest rate environment.
summary: HSBC posted a narrow decline in pretax profit in the first half of the year, but beat expectations on the back of a high-interest rate environment.

title: Bank of Japan raises benchmark interest rate, outlines roadmap for trimming bond buying program
content: The central bank said that it will reduce the monthly outright purchases of JGBs to about 3 trillion yen per month in the January to March 2026 quarter.
summary: The central bank said that it will reduce the monthly outright purchases of JGBs to about 3 trillion yen per month in the January to March 2026 quarter.

title: Here's everything you need to know about the Fed decision coming Wednesday
content: This week's Federal Reserve meeting might not have much bearing on the present but  potentially it could have a lot to do with the future.
summary: This week's Federal Reserve meeting might not have much bearing on the present but  potentially it could have a lot to do with the future.

title: I’ve been to 100 countries. I didn't expect to want to return to these 5
content: Travel enthusiast Todd Miller identifies the five countries that he had assumed would be "one and done" places, but that left him wanting to know much more.
summary: Travel enthusiast Todd Miller identifies the five countries that he had assumed would be "one and done" places, but that left him wanting to know much more.

title: Here's how much athletes at the Paris Olympics earn for winning medals
content: Aside from a medal, a stuffed toy of the Olympics mascot and an official event poster, some medal winners are accorded additional financial rewards.
summary: Aside from a medal, a stuffed toy of the Olympics mascot and an official event poster, some medal winners are accorded additional financial rewards.

title: Samsung second-quarter operating profit soars 1,458% as AI demand remains strong; results top estimates
content: Samsung Electronics posted higher-than-expected second-quarter revenue and operating profit, as demand for advanced memory chips remained strong.
summary: Samsung Electronics posted higher-than-expected second-quarter revenue and operating profit, as demand for advanced memory chips remained strong.

title: TikTok-owner ByteDance's Singapore workers suffer mass food poisoning
content: An office of TikTok-owner ByteDance in Singapore was hit by a mass food poisoning incident on Tuesday, according to local authorities.
summary: An office of TikTok-owner ByteDance in Singapore was hit by a mass food poisoning incident on Tuesday, according to local authorities.

title: Podcast: Samsung bets on the Galaxy Ring and AI as its next big thing
content: Samsung this month released the $399 Ring, the South Korean tech giant's first foray into smart rings.
summary: Samsung this month released the $399 Ring, the South Korean tech giant's first foray into smart rings.

title: Microsoft shares drop as cloud miss overshadows better-than-expected revenue and earnings
content: Microsoft said it was still supply-constrained for delivering artificial intelligence services to cloud clients. But executives called for cloud acceleration.
summary: Microsoft said it was still supply-constrained for delivering artificial intelligence services to cloud clients. But executives called for cloud acceleration.

title: CNBC Daily Open: BOJ ups rate to 0.25%; U.S. stocks fall; Starbucks' same-store sales decline
content: Japan’s central bank lifted its benchmark interest rate to “around 0.25%” from the previous range of 0% to 0.1%.
summary: Japan’s central bank lifted its benchmark interest rate to “around 0.25%” from the previous range of 0% to 0.1%.

title: AMD says data center sales more than doubled in a year
content: AMD shares are down about 7% year to date, despite the chipmaker being the second largest vendor of data center GPUs after Nvidia.
summary: AMD shares are down about 7% year to date, despite the chipmaker being the second largest vendor of data center GPUs after Nvidia.

title: Where are China's ultra-rich parking their wealth amid a slowing economy?
content: The Chinese ultra-rich population is expected to swell to 144,897 by 2028 from 98,551 in 2023, where are they parking their wealth?
summary: The Chinese ultra-rich population is expected to swell to 144,897 by 2028 from 98,551 in 2023, where are they parking their wealth?

title: Microsoft tells employees it will hand out one-time cash awards of up to 25% of annual bonus
content: Microsoft wants to reward rank-and-file employees for helping to deliver accelerating revenue growth for the fiscal year that just ended.
summary: Microsoft wants to reward rank-and-file employees for helping to deliver accelerating revenue growth for the fiscal year that just ended.

title: Starbucks revenue misses estimates as same-store sales decline for second straight quarter
content: Starbucks' stock has tumbled 21% this year, fueled by concerns about weaker demand for its coffee in the U.S. and China.
summary: Starbucks' stock has tumbled 21% this year, fueled by concerns about weaker demand for its coffee in the U.S. and China.

title: 'Sports tourism' is huge. But the Summer Olympics caused travel to Paris to plummet
content: It's a common misconception that host cities see an explosion of travelers around the Olympic Games, says OAG's Chief Analyst John Grant.
summary: It's a common misconception that host cities see an explosion of travelers around the Olympic Games, says OAG's Chief Analyst John Grant.

title: Tencent Cloud downplays AI hype when it comes to making games
content: Use of ChatGPT-like generative AI in gaming is still in an exploratory phase, said Liang Chen, general manager of Tencent Cloud's internet industry department.
summary: Use of ChatGPT-like generative AI in gaming is still in an exploratory phase, said Liang Chen, general manager of Tencent Cloud's internet industry department.

title: Disney's Marvel needed a direction. With a big box office and familiar faces, it may have one
content: "Deadpool & Wolverine" smashes box office records as Marvel Studios looks to right the ship after a series of theatrical missteps.
summary: "Deadpool & Wolverine" smashes box office records as Marvel Studios looks to right the ship after a series of theatrical missteps.

title: UAE set to welcome even more millionaires as wealthy individuals abandon the UK
content: "Push factors include the prospect of higher taxes under a new Labour government," one investor told CNBC.
summary: "Push factors include the prospect of higher taxes under a new Labour government," one investor told CNBC.

title: Pinterest shares tumble nearly 15% on weak guidance
content: Pinterest shares sank when the company reported its second-quarter earnings and provided third-quarter guidance that was lower than analyst estimates.
summary: Pinterest shares sank when the company reported its second-quarter earnings and provided third-quarter guidance that was lower than analyst estimates.

title: First Solar tops second-quarter estimates but leaves forecast unchanged amid election uncertainty
content: First Solar maintained its sales guidance for the year of $4.4 billion to $4.6 billion.
summary: First Solar maintained its sales guidance for the year of $4.4 billion to $4.6 billion.

title: Google parent Alphabet's partnership with AI firm Anthropic under investigation in the UK
content: The U.K.'s Competition and Markets Authority said that it is investigating Google parent Alphabet's partnership with artificial intelligence startup Anthropic.
summary: The U.K.'s Competition and Markets Authority said that it is investigating Google parent Alphabet's partnership with artificial intelligence startup Anthropic.

title: Stellantis to offer broad buyouts to U.S. salaried workers, warns of possible layoffs
content: The automaker, which reported disappointing first-half results, said that if not enough its employees take buyouts, involuntary terminations could follow.
summary: The automaker, which reported disappointing first-half results, said that if not enough its employees take buyouts, involuntary terminations could follow.

title: CrowdStrike shares plunge 9.7% to lowest level of the year on report that Delta may seek damages
content: CrowdStrike shares fell after CNBC reported on Monday that Delta hired an attorney to seek compensation following the July 19 global IT outage.
summary: CrowdStrike shares fell after CNBC reported on Monday that Delta hired an attorney to seek compensation following the July 19 global IT outage.

title: Russia approves law allowing use of crypto for global payments as it faces ongoing sanctions
content: Russian lawmakers on Tuesday approved a new that permits international payments via cryptocurrencies.
summary: Russian lawmakers on Tuesday approved a new that permits international payments via cryptocurrencies.

title: Meta agrees to $1.4 billion settlement in Texas biometric data lawsuit over Facebook images
content: The lawsuit by Texas against Meta involved the Facebook owner's capture and use of biometric data from photos and videos without authorization.
summary: The lawsuit by Texas against Meta involved the Facebook owner's capture and use of biometric data from photos and videos without authorization.

title: Older GLP-1 drug from Novo Nordisk may slow Alzheimer's disease progression by protecting the brain, study says
content: Liraglutide is sold under the brand names Saxenda and Victoza, and sales are declining as blockbuster GLP-1s Ozempic and Wegovy skyrocket in demand.
summary: Liraglutide is sold under the brand names Saxenda and Victoza, and sales are declining as blockbuster GLP-1s Ozempic and Wegovy skyrocket in demand.
